```{python}
#| echo: false

import pandas as pd
from itables import show
from pyhere import here
import mistune

# Load the schedule data
schedule = pd.read_csv(here("course-info", "schedule.csv"))

# Filter for published items
schedule = schedule[schedule['Publish'] == 'x']

# Remove the Publish column from display
schedule = schedule.drop(columns=['Publish'])

# Replace all NaN values with empty strings to avoid "NaN" display
schedule = schedule.fillna("")

# Function to render markdown
def render_markdown(text):
    # Handle NaN/None cases
    if pd.isna(text) or text == "nan" or text == "NaN":
        return ""
    
    to_render = str(text)
    # mistune adds \n at the end of paragraphs, so we strip it.
    return mistune.html(to_render).strip()

# Apply markdown rendering to all string columns
from pandas.api.types import is_string_dtype, is_object_dtype

for col in schedule.columns:
    if is_string_dtype(schedule[col]) or is_object_dtype(schedule[col]):
         schedule[col] = schedule[col].apply(render_markdown)

# Display the schedule
show(schedule, dom='t', classes="display nowrap compact", paging=False, allow_html=True)
```
